    		Change Request
    	Get help fast Problems logging inHaving trouble accessing course materialsAccessibility Issues"Accessibility" in this context refers to the practice of making a website usable by as many people as possible, taking into account factors such as user disabilities, network connection speeds, etc. We are continually striving to improve the experience for all of our visitors. If you have any questions or suggestions regarding the accessibility of any Chico State web content, please contact the Office of Accessible Technology and Services at oats@csuchico.edu.To report a broken link, content error, or accessibility issue, please submit a ticket.Submit a Ticket
Issue or requestIssue or request type: Select one
Report a broken linkReport content errorsRequest a changeMake a suggestionReport an accessibility issue
You must select the type of issue or request from the dropdown menu.URL of page:Enter a valid url for the page to be changed.Broken link destination URL:Enter a valid url for the broken link.Describe the issue: A description of the issue is required.Contact informationFirst name: You must enter your first name.Last name: You must enter your last name.Your email: You must enter a valid email address.Leave this input empty if you want
                        Form id
                        Invalid CATPCHASubmit
We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, the Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus.We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.MenuChico State HomeAboutAcademicsAdmissionsCost & AidStudent LifeAcademic DepartmentsAthleticsAlumniParentsChico FactsGiveResourcesQuicklinksCampus CalendarCampus SafetyJob OpportunitiesAccessibility Resource CenterAnnual Security Report (PDF)
We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
